intro: Bunochilus crassus, commonly known as the broad-leaved bunochilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its robust, succulent stems and broad, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets, typically blooming in late summer. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its morphology reflects evolutionary strategies for water conservation and efficient photosynthesis in challenging climates.
